title: Kalchef
author: Kalchef
content: Correct me if I am wrong, I am just a small boy anyway, so what do I know? To me whales are losing power with Bitcoin adoption, years ago whales are in charge of many Bitcoin and many people are saying, only few people control Bitcoin, since they own many Bitcoin, but right now Bitcoin is spreading to every corner of the world, I am not saying that whales still don't have power, I am just saying they are having less Bitcoin than before and it's getting to the hands of many more people.

comments.author: Ever-young
comments.body: Whales don't control Bitcoin they are just holders like you and I, the differences is that they hold huge amount why you hold small amount, when they sell the price most time shakes, because they can cause panic in the entire market, but it doesn't not in any way means they have power of control over the currency Bitcoin. To the level of my knowledge and understanding. Bitcoin is not controlled by anyone.

comments.author: siedemtrzy
comments.body: Quote from: Ever-young on March 17, 2023, 03:49:06 PMWhales don't control Bitcoin they are just holders like you and I, the differences is that they hold huge amount why you hold small amount, when they sell the price most time shakes, because they can cause panic in the entire market, but it doesn't not in any way means they have power of control over the currency Bitcoin. To the level of my knowledge and understanding. Bitcoin is not controlled by anyone. Whales don't control it, but they can affect price. For a lot of people it's a lot, but I only see it as opportunity to follow them sometimes. If they sell - you buy. If they buy - you keep holding or sell.

comments.body: Quote from: Kalchef on March 17, 2023, 03:17:32 PMSnippedIs this the reason why you created the thread just to inform us that bitcoin is now no more only  in the hands of whales but also spread out to individuals? to be frank with you there's nothing new here to learn from what you just posted because everyone knows both the whales and individual person can have bitcoin in their possession as long as they were ready to invest, hodl or sell, you could have just make this as a reply on other topics than creating a new thread with less quality post as this, i encourage you to read on this link below https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1649348.0

comments.author: pooya87
comments.body: There are definitely whales who have lost bitcoin over the times they go against the market. We sometimes see this whenever price shoots up despite their attempts at market manipulation by dumping large amounts or placing big sell walls hoping it could prevent the rise.But there are also whales who were smarter and didn't go against the market and actually increased their wealth. In any case the way bitcoin blockchain is makes it hard to come to any conclusion about how many whales there are and how much bitcoin they own or whether their "wealth" has gone up or down.

comments.body: We don't know your real age here and it doesn't matter for anyone here. No one is interested to know your age. You can be claiming to be a small boy who knows how to use the internet even coming to bitcointalk forum yet a small. You can't deceive me.One can't say whales do not control bitcoin, if there are whales in bitcoin then they must have influence in it.  Mostly the price can be influence by the whales but bitcoin itself can not be controlled because bitcoin operates in a decentralized system in which individuals who have the coins do what they want and not others do anything like deduction of different kinds of levies for weekly and monthly. In bitcoin you only pay a transaction fee in the process of transferring the coin to another wallet.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: un_rank on March 17, 2023, 05:13:09 PMI have no clue what you mean by power of the creator and the influence of influential people is very limited, more notably if you are speaking down on bitcoin.If you are really interested, you should look at some of his topics, and then it will surely be clearer to you what he meant. I was hoping that he finally left those ideas behind, but it seems that he will take the credit again because the price of BTC is rising...People who have large amounts of BTC can influence the market, the only question is whether they want to and to what extent. Of course, when it comes to profit, whales behave like the real killer whales in the oceans, and small fish don't stand a chance against their tactics if they trade. A lot of money usually creates more money, and a little money usually leads to a complete loss. We must know that someone's loss is always someone's gain, so if 95% of crypto traders lose, that means that those 5% make exceptional profits.

comments.author: Gayong88
comments.body: Within the cryptocurrency community, individuals or organizations who own large amounts of Bitcoin and have the power to manipulate the value of Bitcoin are known as whales. I think that until now whales are still influential in the Bitcoin market and are the caretaker. Especially if a group of whales decides to unite, the impact is very significant.What you say is true, regarding their strength starting to decrease. Why is that?? This is due to the growing adoption of Bitcoin which is increasing which allows more people to access and use Bitcoin.The proof can be seen in the increasing number of exchanges and wallets that store large amounts of Bitcoin. As more people join the network, the number of whales holding large amounts of Bitcoin decreases, making it more difficult for them to manipulate the market.

comments.body: The whales do not control the bitcoin price. If we talk about the past, the whales with a lot of bitcoins can move the bitcoin price but for now, I don't think the whales can do it because it means they need a lot of money. Maybe they could make a fishing rod to get people interested and think the whales did something for the price.And now the whales may follow the bitcoin price.
